fields.description: When you create a blueprint file list while viewing another file list page, it creates the new file list as a sibling of the current and not as a child. When creating pages for example, if you create a new page while seeing another page, the new page will be a child of the current page. This behavior is misleading for file lists.
fields.summary: File lists are created as siblings of current file list and not as children

fields.description:
After OnDemand upgrades, we sometimes have instances that appear normal (e.g. when viewing the dashboard) but give 404s when you go to view a particular page. The error is:
{noformat}
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.StaxUtils
{noformat}

Our monitoring systems only check the dashboard (which returns a 200), so we do not detect this failure until the customer reports it. Restarting the instance will clear up the issue, but it's inconvenient for the customer as they need to contact Support about it first.


*Temporary Work around:* Disable the 
com.atlassian.confluence.confluence-applinks-transformer-plugin
fields.summary: Page not found when visiting certain pages in Confluence, logs NoClassDefFoundError: StaxUtils
JIRA macros are failing with a 'Error rendering macro' message

fields.description: I was trying to move pages from the root of one space to the root of another. I ended up with one space having its home page orphaned.  We got this error message: "The root page @home could not be found in space [space name] " Is there a way to fix the problem? I have tried to reset the "Home Page" in the "Space Details" section of the Space Admin, but it does not work
fields.summary: Not able to set an  orphaned home page back as the home page of a space

fields.description:
When adding a Confluence Page Gadget to the JIRA dashboard, view or edit links are not being displayed. 

Tested in Firefox {{34.0}}, Safari {{Version 8.0.2 (10600.2.5)}} and Chrome {{Version 39.0.2171.95 (64-bit)}}. 

Even referred to [Registering External Gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Registering+External+Gadgets]

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to JIRA
2. Add Gadget
3. Search for Confluence Page Gadget
4. Check both Show View Link & Show Edit Link
5. Click Save

h3. Expected: \\
Icons or links to edit or view confluence page
As illustrated in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Page+Gadget

h3. Actual: \\
No links to edit or view confluence page

h3. Console: \\
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget Does Not Display View Or Edit Links

fields.description:
When you insert a JIM for total issue count results from a saved filter, clicking on that should bring you to the filter in JIRA Issue Navigator.  Instead, it brings you to the Issue Navigator with the results, but not displaying the actual filter.  Meaning, things like columns setup for the filter and the filter name are not displayed, instead default columns show up and "Search" is shown where the filter name would be.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a saved filter in JIRA that is shared appropriately, copy that link (ie https://example.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=10300)
# Add JIM to a Confluence page to display number of issues, using that link or filter
# Click on that link from the Confluence page; you'll be directed to a generic Issue Navigator page with the filter results showing default columns
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro does not maintain Filter information when linking to JIRA from Confluence page

fields.description:
Dynamic JQL Query get silently replaced by a static query in JIRA issue macro in Confluence.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Create a new wiki space
- Add the JIRA Issue macro
- Write a JQL query that should return an issue 
- Notice that the original query is substituted with a trivial "key=xxx"

*The big concern* is that: "if the created dynamic query was to return more than one issue at a later point of time, the new issue would never show up in the list."
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro silently replace dynamic JQL query to a static one

fields.description:
Children of restricted pages do not get hidden from users who do not have permission to see the parent.

Steps to reproduce:

* Create an unrestricted page. Create a child page, also unrestricted.
* Create a second user. Confirm the user can see the two new pages in their dashboard.
* Restrict viewing of the parent page away from the new user.
* Confirm users dashboard is no longer showing parent page, but is showing child page.

When a page has viewing restricted to a group, users not in that group can see the page listed on their dashboard in the popular tab

Versions in OnDemand:
Confluence 5.4-OD-21-019
fields.summary: Confluence OnDemand dashboard - popular tab - user is shown links to pages they are restricted from viewing
Unintentional breakage of UI REST resource (/rest/ui/1.0/content/).

fields.description: With the changes made to the administration panel, the documentation as found [here| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Adding+and+Inviting+Users] is not accurate any more, in particular the "Allowing user signup" section is out-dated. Could you please revise this?

fields.description: Cannot edit an excel spreadsheet embedded within a Confluence Cloud page using Mac OS.  Checked online User Guide, Support pages & knowledge base.  All docs say that this should work with OpenOffice, but it does _not_. Only reference with any useful info was a feature request, but this is not an added feature, it is a non-working existing feature that you advertise as being included.  Either fix your documentation to specify that this only works from Windows machines or make this a priority to fix.  Not being able to do this cuts the usefulness of Confluence Cloud by ~30%.  Huge impact for my organization.
fields.summary: "Edit Document" for embedded excel document does not work in MacOS X with FF & OpenOffice

fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro doesn't render multi-line text fields containing Wiki Rendering

fields.description:
The Emails that are automatically send by our Confluence onDemand Instance show embedded images as attachments.

Digging into the MIME-Body of the Email, I saw, that Images are added using "Content-Disposition: attachment".

But Images, that are embedded into the HTML-Part of a MIME-Message, should have "Content-Disposition: inline".

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIME#Content-Disposition

I currently cannot verify if this is a IBM Notes-only Bug, nevertheless, the correct "Content-Disposition" is "inline" in this case.

Also see RFC 2183:
http://www.rfc-base.org/txt/rfc-2183.txt
fields.summary: Images embedded in Emails show up as Attachments (in IBM Notes)

h2. ***Summary***
The icons for the info, note and warning macros are displayed properly in Confluence.
!Screen Shot 2014-12-03 at 10.07.57 PM.png|thumbnail!

The PDF export does not include the icons
!Screen Shot 2014-12-03 at 10.08.12 PM.png|thumbnail!

h2. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create or edit a page
# Add a Info, Note and Warning macro to the page
# Save - Macros and icons are rendered properly (/) 
# Export page to PDF -  icons are not rendered properly (*missing*) (x)
# Export space to PDF -  icons are not rendered properly (*missing*) (x)

The icons for the macros are visible in the PDF export

fields.description:
The Table of Contents (TOC) macro is not working with the Numbered Headings macro. Please see image below:

!test_page.png!

We expect the Numbered Headings content to show up in the Table of Contents, but nothing is showing up. See image of the "Edit" page below:

!edit_test_page.png!

If I copy the content of the Numbered Headings and place it outside the macro, the Table of Contents start showing the list as expected - it looks like the TOC is not being able to gather information inside the Numbered Headings macro.
fields.summary: Table of Contents (TOC) is not working with Numbered Headings

fields.description:
Users are getting confused with the current Widget Connector description text, which says that Google Docs can be embed, but in fact only Google Docs Presentations can be embed, and not Texts and Spreadsheets.
This limitation should be very literal on the description. Something like "You can only embed presentations in Google Docs. Other types of Google Docs such as spreadsheets and text documents are not supported.".
fields.summary: Insert 'Widget Connector' macro description text is not clear enough

fields.description:
The site import drops the whole database schema. This means that the BandanaPluginStateStore loses its memory.

E.g. a bundled plugin which is disabled by default but was enabled programmatically on startup is considered disabled, although the OSGi bundles are still enabled. That can lead to a variety of symptoms:
* Macros work but their i18n is missing.
* Plugins cannot be enabled/disabled.

While we have only tested this on 5.0 milestones, this has almost certainly always been the case.
fields.summary: Plugin state is wrong after site import

Scenario:

When an Image with a very long width 1261px is insert to the page.
# In blank page without section.

Therefore, user prefer to have the image auto resize to fit into the sections instead of having the scroll bar below.

fields.summary: Error using Google document macro: "Google properties not yet initialised"
Wiki Markup does not change the font color of links

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new template with anchors (the Anchor macro).
# While still editing the template, try to add a link to that anchor via Insert Link and choosing "Advanced".

When entering the link to the anchor text ("#anchorname"), Confluence complains that "The markup provided is not valid link markup".

Doing exactly the same on a regular page, rather than a template, works as expected (a link is created to the anchor on the page).
fields.summary: Unable to add links to anchors in the template editor

fields.description:
If an instance has the Workbox add-ons disabled in their account, backspace/delete no longer works in the Confluence Editor.

As a workaround, please ensure that the _Workbox Host Plugin (com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin)_  is enabled and that _/plugins/servlet/myworkserviceselector.action_ is set to _displays in-app notifications_ (the default).

*To OnDemand customers, please open a support case to have Atlassian support enable these add-ons for you.*

Workbox plugins being disabled can also stop the JIRA Issue macro from working.
fields.summary: Backspace or delete no longer works in Confluence Editor with Chrome and  Workbox disabled

h3. Workaround

We are working on a fix urgently.

Exporting pages to PDF is currently functional. It is possible to export all pages to PDF and then merge them into one document using a guide such as [this|http://support.apple.com/kb/ht4075].

If you need to urgently export a full space to PDF then you can:

# Export the space to XML: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Exporting+Confluence+Pages+and+Spaces+to+XML
# Install a [local version of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Setup+Guide] using the [OnDemand version|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-od]
# [Restore the space you backed up earlier|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Space] into your local Confluence instance.
# Export the space to PDF from your local instance.
fields.summary: Not possible to export space to PDF

fields.description:
The Space Attachments macro in Confluence shows the list of page numbers at the bottom:

!page_numbers.png!

If you click on any other page after retrieving the first one the macro simply disappears instead of showing the next page of attachments.
fields.summary: Space Attachments macro disappears when switching pages

fields.description:
Attempting to embed an XLSX file containing an image will end up in an error:
!embed.png|thumbnail!

Seems like CONF-16783 has gone worse for the new format.
fields.summary: Excel viewfile macro broken for XLSX files containing images

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an OnDemand instance with a space using Documentation Theme
# Make a backup of the instance
# Import it into either a confluence-only OD instance, or a BTF instance
# View the space theme
#- Observe that the space theme is Global Look and Feel

h3. Workaround
Set the space theme manually
fields.summary: Theme setting does not persist when importing from OnDemand to BTF or to an OD Confluence-only instance

fields.description: When an evernote link (ex: evernote:///view/43202943/s314/524c2486-c2ca-44d4-ad86-5802ea5564d8/524c2486-c2ca-44d4-ad86-5802ea5564d8/) is pasted into a confluence edit it shows as normal in the menu but inserts the instances url into the link.
fields.summary: Pasting a link to a protocol (eg. ftp:// or evernote://) modifies the link and adds the base URL to it - resulting in a broken link

fields.description:
"The Attachment macro's drag-and-drop container does not respect the configured space/page target of the macro (and instead uploads to the current page), even though the "browse" button in the same macro does. Correct?"

I believe that I may have stumbled upon a defect with the Attachments Control on a confluence page.

When I drag-and-drop a file onto an Attachments control embedded on a confluence page the file does not show up in the list but instead shows up under Tools>Attachments.  This is not the desired behavior.

When I use the Browse for Files option from the Attachments control  embedded within a confluence page the file does show in the control and does not show under Tools>Attachments.
fields.summary: Attachments Control - Drag and Drop vs. Browse for files

fields.description:
h4. Scenario
After using the Site Importer tool to restore a Confluence backup, users are presented with the error below when trying to create new users:
{noformat}
Oops - an error has occurred

(https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/)System Error
A system error has occurred — our apologies!

For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+Knowledge+Base+Home) for a solution.

If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/contactadministrators.action) to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system (http://support.atlassian.com/) with the following information:

a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
a copy of the error and system information found below
a copy of the application logs (if possible).

Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/raisesupportrequest.action) to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage… (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/)

Cause

com.atlassian.confluence.core.InsufficientPrivilegeException: User [example] does not have the required privileges.
at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.addMembership(DefaultUserAccessor.java:169)
{noformat}

h4. Cause
Apparently the import overwrites the groups in OnDemand, and the *users* group gets deleted in case it is not present in the backup. With the absence of that group, Confluence is unable to include new users to it and throws the error above.

h4. Workaround
Create the *users* group manually after the import
fields.summary: Unable to create new users after Site Import

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Edit the 'Product Requirements' blueprint
# Add any text within the existing text (below the 'Page Properties' macro. It can be at the bottom of the page)
# Save the edited blueprint
# Create a new page using the 'Product Requirements' blueprint
# Notice the 'Epic' line on the table within the 'Page Properties' macro is missing. Usually it should be on the second line of the table, below the 'Target Release' line.
fields.summary: When the 'Product Requirement' blueprint is edited, the 'Epic' line on the table goes missing

fields.description:
When I copy code into the code macro, there are newlines added for every line of code.  I then I have to delete every other line in order to make it look right.

If I copy code from Word, I get THREE newlines added for every line of code.  This is ridiculous.

If I paste in code into the regular Confluence editor without the use of a macro, it treats every line as a paragraph, adding unwanted space between lines; these have to be replaced with shift-enter by hand.  Even if you select "preformatted", the pasted lines are reformated as paragraphs.

Why is there not a simple way to paste in code into Confluence?

This is occurring in the hosted Confluence.
fields.summary: Pasting code into the code macro adds unwanted newlines.

fields.description:
*Symptom:* LucidChart add-on is not visible to Confluence Cloud users.  The behaviour occurs after a restart.

*Resolution:* Raise a support request via support.atlassian.com and support will apply a fix to reveal the add-on.
fields.summary: LucidChart add-on not working or visible in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
An existing label for a site does not always appear when it has been created for a space.

To reproduce this issue:
# Create a new space and add a new label to the homepage of the space
# Add an attachment to the same page
# Select Tools > Attachments > Select 'pencil' icon > type first 3 letters

The workaround for this issue is to access the attachments menu from:
# Navigating to Space > Select 'Space Tools' > choose 'Content Tools' > 'Attachments'

This behaviour is demonstrated in the attached examples.  The behaviour persists after content indexing for an instance.

No error logs are generated when the autocomplete feature is unsuccessful.
fields.summary: Attachment labels do not always autocomplete

fields.description:
Under certain conditions, fetching the status of a Workbox notification can OOME the server.

This was observed on OD instance {{rdcgroup.atlassian.net}} via ZOOME ([link to OOME details|http://zoome2.uc-inf.net/zoome/_design/zoome2/public/oome.html?oome=20140730-223816_rdcgroup.atlassian.net_confluence]

The truncated stack trace that blows the stack out and causes the OOME is:

{noformat}
at java.lang.OutOfMemoryError.<init>()V (OutOfMemoryError.java:25)
  at java.util.Arrays.copyOf([CI)[C (Arrays.java:2882)
  [...]
  at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.DelegatingResultSet.getObject(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/Object; (DelegatingResultSet.java:328)
  at net.java.ao.EntityManager.find(Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/String;Lnet/java/ao/Query;)[Lnet/java/ao/RawEntity; (EntityManager.java:777)
  at net.java.ao.EntityManager.find(Ljava/lang/Class;Lnet/java/ao/Query;)[Lnet/java/ao/RawEntity; (EntityManager.java:675)
  at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.find(Ljava/lang/Class;Lnet/java/ao/Query;)[Lnet/java/ao/RawEntity; (EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:181)
  at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects.find(Ljava/lang/Class;Lnet/java/ao/Query;)[Lnet/java/ao/RawEntity; (TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:335)
  [...]
  at com.atlassian.mywork.host.dao.ao.AONotificationDao.getItemStatus(Lcom/atlassian/mywork/model/Notification;)Lcom/atlassian/mywork/model/Status; (AONotificationDao.java:71)
  at com.atlassian.mywork.host.dao.ao.AONotificationDao.create(Lcom/atlassian/mywork/model/Notification;Ljava/util/Date;)Lcom/atlassian/mywork/model/Notification; (AONotificationDao.java:60)
  at com.atlassian.mywork.host.dao.ao.AONotificationDao.create(Lcom/atlassian/mywork/model/Notification;)Lcom/atlassian/mywork/model/Notification; (AONotificationDao.java:52)
{noformat}

Looking at the calling code in {{AONotificationDao#getItemStatus}}, we see:

{code:java}
for (AONotification other : ao.find(AONotification.class, select().where("USER = ? AND GLOBAL_ID = ?", getStringKeyForUsername(notification.getUser()), globalId)))
{
   return other.getStatus();
}
{code}

Here we have a {{for}} loop that returns from the method on the first loop iteration. However, the call to {{ao.find}} is unbounded, and so potentially can return a very large result set. It doesn't matter that the for loop only wants the first one.

It appears that if a given Notification has a large number of associated AONotifications for that user, then memory usaqe will be high, and may trigger an OOME.

This method needs to be rewritten to limit the size of the result set to a single item.
fields.summary: Fetching workbox notification status causes OOME

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Users are currently unable to download attachments containing ampersand (&) in the file name via email when they are not logged in.

h4. Scenario

I'm watching a page in Confluence, so basically every update made to that page is going to generate a notification to me. At certain point, me (or any other user) add an attachment to that page, named *Bruno Rosa Test & Atlassian Support.xls*. If I navigate to the page and click the attachment, I'm able to download it without any problems. However, I'm not going to be able to do the same through the notification that Confluence sent about "adding the attachment to the page":

!confluence-notification.png!

Clicking on the link to the attachment inside the email directs to a login page. Once authenticated, I should be able to download the attachment, instead I get a *Page Not Found* error:

!page-not-found.png!

This is happening because the URL is wrong. Copying the URL from the link inside the email content I get:

{noformat}
https://brosa-test.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/524299/Bruno%20Rosa%20Test%20%26%20Atlassian%20Support.xls?version=1&modificationDate=1412800037199&api=v2&src=mail&src.mail.timestamp=1412800037235&src.mail.notification=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-content-notifications-plugin%3Aattachment-created-notification&src.mail.recipient=ff80808148f15a580148f15a84ad0001
{noformat}

Which is *correct*! However, when I'm directed to the login page (to authenticate before downloading the file), this is the URL appearing in the address box:

{noformat}
https://brosa-test.atlassian.net/login?dest-url=/wiki%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F524299%2FBruno+Rosa+Test+&permission-violation=true
{noformat}

Notice that the name of the file after the *Bruno Rosa Test* part is gone from the URL - the *& Atlassian Support.xls* is gone. Of course that once we authenticate, the download fails and we get the *Page Not Found* error - the URL at this point is (after authenticating):

{noformat}
https://brosa-test.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/524299/Bruno+Rosa+Test+
{noformat}

If I re-do all the steps using a file named *Bruno Rosa Test Atlassian Support.xls*, everything works fine.

h4. Workaround

Make sure you are logged in *before* trying to download an attachment via a notification/email message containing ampersand (&) in the name.

*OR*

Don't use ampersand (&) in the name of the file.
fields.summary: Unable to download attachments containing ampersand (&) via email

h5.Steps to reproduce:

# Get an OnDemand instance that has JIRA as well, on fireball 185-187.
# On A confluence page write any sentence that contains "UTF-8", and the UTF-8 part of the text will become a link as "https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/browse/UTF-8.

EDIT: Just found out that this also effect ISO formatted dates like " 2012-11-15" it will return an invalid JIRA link.

Edit2: This appears to affect also strings like "rxx", "r3543", where it produces a link that looks lik "https://<instance name>/source/changelog/TP/?cs=343"

fields.summary: 'Share a Link' does not notify users on the workbox notifications

fields.description:
When creating or editing a Page Properties Report Macro the following text is displayed:

{quote}Displays pages that contain a specific label and the Page Properties macro as a table. The table includes a link to each page and summary information contained in the Page Properties macro on that page. [Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Report+Macro]

Label [         ]
The label used on pages containing the Page Properties macro.{quote}

The problem is that the Macro actually looks for labels on the page containing the macro and in the Page Properties macro itself.

Pages listed have one of this 2 conditions:
* Correct page label and the Page Properties Macro has the same label
* Correct page label and the Page Properties Macro doesn't have a label (feature introduced recently)

Pages not listed have one of this 2 conditions:
* Correct page label but the Page Properties Macro inside the page has a different label
* Don't have the correct page label

Documentation on [Page Properties Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Report+Macro] is more accurate:
{quote}Label: Identifies the label to be used in the Page Properties Report. The report will show data from all pages in the current space containing a Page Properties macro with the same label.{quote}
but it is missing that the Page has to have the label as well. Probably because the macro adds the label automatically to the page.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro has incorrect wording of its functionality

fields.description:
This issue is regarding the cdsframework account's OnDemand service with JIRA and Confluence. Default application access is Confluence only for new users. When the new user creates their account from an invite they get assigned access to the Confluence application and the _jira-users_ group and not the confluence-users group as expected. This is causing a lot of issues as new users sign up and they have no access to the site resources until an administrator goes in and manually fixes the group assignments.

I hope this is just a configuration issue but I have been through the docs and the admin interface and can see no way to address the problem.

According to the following link, the user should be granted access to the '[product]-users' group when granted access to an application product of the OnDemand service (in this case Confluence, which is occurring as a result of the configured default application access) but that is _not_ happening.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Default+Groups+and+Permissions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand

Thanks for your time.
fields.summary: New user group assignment is not working properly in Atlassian OnDemand service

fields.description:
If you add Background details while creating a Decision Blueprint, special characters such as scandinavian letters are not rendered, and instead you see the html encoding, like "ö" for "ö".

To replicate:
1. Click Create
2. Select Decision Blueprint
3. Type any Scandinavian character in Background details (Å,å,Ä,ä,Ö,ö)  
4. Click Create

See screenshot.  I have not tried this with other characters yet.  Can be reproduced in Firefox, Chrome, and IE.
fields.summary: While creating a Decision Blueprint, special characters (like ö) in the Background description are not rendered
BuildEdgeIndexServlet XSRF

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms
Site import will fail with the error {{There was an error uploading your file: invalid CEN header (bad signature)}} when the file is zip in 64 bit format.

In this case site import could not be done if the backup includes attachment size larger than 4Gb.

h3. Workaround

Export the backup from Confluence server which is using JAVA 1.6
fields.summary: Cloud Confluence Site import fail when the zip larger than 4Gb is in 64 bit zips format

Recent changes seem to cause some issues in the ‘div’ Macro. In fact div tags are offsetting the elements out of a border.

I have attached a screen-shot for the behavior as well for reproducing the issue. You can notice the elements out of of border. I reproduced this in latest OnDemand version *5.3-OD-7* in chrome v *30*
fields.summary: Div tags are offsetting the elements out of a border

This didn't use to happen.

fields.description:
After adding a Confluence Page Gadget to the JIRA dashboard, then selecting a confluence page with links, clicking on a link will cause the gadget to load a page within the gadget instead of jumping to a page. 

*See attachments*

Tested in Firefox {{34.0}}, Safari {{Version 8.0.2 (10600.2.5)}} and Chrome {{Version 39.0.2171.95 (64-bit)}}. 

Recreated on test instance

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to JIRA
2. Add Gadget
3. Search for Confluence Page Gadget
4. Select a page with links
5. Click Save
6. Click on link within gadget

h3. Expected: \\
Takes user to page

h3. Actual: \\
Page loads in gadget which is not ideal for viewing
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget Loads Page, Instead Of Jumping To Page When Clicking Link

fields.description:
Recently, Gliffy introduced a reminder to all users about plugin updates. As OnDemand customers have no control of plugin updates, this reminder is not necessary. Also, the reminder asks OnDemand users to contact Confluence administrators, which is misleading.

This can be turned off on ad-hoc basis via https://hostname/wiki/admin/plugin-repository/gliffypluginadmin.action, but we should make this disabled out-of-the-box in OnDemand.
fields.summary: Turn off Gliffy reminder on plugin updates in Confluence OnDemand

fields.description: Manually disabled system plugins are re-enabled after a restart.
fields.summary: Persist system plugin state between restarts

fields.description:
If you have JIRA and Confluence linked up, and JIRA is in different language (eg. German). Confluence will not display any results until you key in the field names in English.

These are OK:
key;summary;labels;description;acceptance criteria

These only show data in the status column:
Schlüssel,Übersicht,Typ,erstellt,aktualisiert


Suggested solution: Key in the field names in English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Confluence and JIRA
# Create a page with a JIRA Issues Macro
# In the macro, enter Schlüssel,Übersicht,Typ,erstellt
#- You will see that only the status is displayed
# Change the fields above to English "key;summary;labels;description;acceptance criteria"
#- You will see that all columns display correctly.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro shows empty results if JIRA fields are in different language

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:

When editing a page:

* Add Table of Content Macro
* Add a Paragraph
* Add a Note Macro 
** Edit it and enter an Optional Title
* Add another Paragraph
* Add a Tip Macro
** Edit it and enter an Optional Title
* Save the page

*Expected*:

Table of Contents just to display the two Parapgraphs

*Output*:

It is displaying the Paragraphs + the Optional Title for the Note and Tip Macros.

Please see the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Table of Contents showing entries for titles from the Note and Tip Macros

Using the current version of Confluence with the current version of the Mobile plugin.

The Usage Stats add-on has been upgraded to 0.16.4.  Now it cannot be enabled in any instance.  First it will display this error, "This add-on failed to enable. Your license may be invalid. Please refer to the logs for more information."  After trying to enable it one more time, you then get the error, "This add-on could not be loaded. It has one or more errors which prevent it from being enabled." and you can no longer try to enable. 

I've been able to replicate this in several instances.

fields.description:
Steps:

# Log in to Confluence On Demand as sysadmin (or customer admin, possibly)
# Go to UPM, so URL looks something like this:
https://nclarke.jira-dev.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/manage/all#manage
# In a second browser tab, log out and then log in as a regular non-admin user.
# In the first browser tab, refresh the UPM page.

Expected behaviour: a "you don't have permission" page. (This is what happens if I run master locally instead of in OD.)

Actual incorrect behaviour: in my OD instance (a recent master snapshot deployed to unicorn) it tries to redirect to the following invalid URL:

{noformat}https://nclarke.jira-dev.com/wikihttps://nclarke.jira-dev.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/manage/all#manage{noformat}
fields.summary: Accessing a UPM page without credentials gives an incorrect redirect URL

Space Attachments Macro is broken in 5.2-OD-13.

I've tested in 5.1-OD-9 and it is working fine there.

Multiple things broken:

* Sorting by name works initially, but then sends you back to the space homepage.  Strangely you cannot go back.
* Trying to use the filter does the same.
fields.summary: Space Attachments Macro Broken in 5.2

fields.description:
It looks like there are two footers in Confluence OnDemand at least in the doc theme, the cross-app footer provided by OnDemand Core, and another very similar one that is presumably provided by the theme itself.

Normally, the OnDemand Core one is scrolled offscreen, but if you put a URL fragment on, it scrolls into view, and scrolls the header out of view.

See attached screenshot from [https://sdog.jira.com/wiki/display/JST/Markup+and+Macro+Test+Page#MarkupandMacroTestPage-Tableofcontents]
fields.summary: Double footer in OnDemand

fields.description:
When using the Table of Content macro along with the Content by Label macro on a page, the Table of Content macro will pick up the Header "Content by Label" if the macro is empty - no pages with that label.

To reproduce:
* Create a page in Confluence
* Insert a Content By Label macro with one label which no page is using
* Insert a Table of Content macro
* Click save, and you will see "Content by Label" (pulled from the text when the macro is empty)
fields.summary: Table of Content macro picks up text "Content by Label" when the Content by Label macro is empty (no pages with label)

fields.description:
On the Edit page screen of Confluence, two scroll bars show up. It cannot be removed by disabling things like Toolbars or resizing the window.

This appears only in Chrome (tested on version 27.0.1453.110)
fields.summary: Two scroll bars in Confluence

fields.description:
The toolbar in the editor is shown with strange spacing between buttons (first screenshot) that should clearly be together.

When hovering over a button, it 'jumps' to the right position (second screenshot), which makes it difficult to work with, because every button changes position as you try to click it.

Affects Confluence OnDemand (version 5.5-OD-22-001)
fields.summary: Editor toolbar hover problem in Chrome

fields.description:
Can no longer access 'Content Indexing' under 'Administration' area of General Configuration in OD Confluence:
* We can no longer access the 'Rebuild' functionality on our OD instance and need to perform a rebuild for the following reason:
** _We cannot utilize the "@" functionality for user mentions for a specific user in our system_
*** The following page (and many others point to this as a possible solution: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/252715/user-mentions-doesn-t-work-in-confluence
** This user has all needed Global and space permissions and is in an Admin group.
** The user is able to tag him himself with the "@" but no other user can.
* Please tell us how to do this or provide another suggestions for how to resolve this issue.
* One workaround is to edit a link and find the user in the modal and change the display text but this is not a suitable option
fields.summary: We cannot utilize the "@" functionality for user mentions for a specific user in our system and can no longer access 'Content Indexing' under 'Administration' area of General Configuration in OD Confluence to resolve

fields.description:
When in Confluence, the favicon is displayed as the default OnDemand icon instead of the customised favicon selected in the "Look and Feel" page.

This does not happen in JIRA, FishEye/Crucible or Bamboo.

!favicon.png!
fields.summary: Confluence ignores favicon settings

fields.description:
h1. Steps to Replicate
* Create a large table with enough columns to require it to scroll off-screen
* Add some Task List Macros, a few on-screen, and others off-screen towards the right.
* You will see you can check the boxes on the left-hand side of the screen, but for any tasks that require you scroll towards the right, they are unclickable.
* This was reported by a customer using Chrome 37.* and IE 11 but I am only able to replicate in Firefox 32.0.3.
fields.summary: Unable to Check Task Box When Horizontal Scroll is Required

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Using Confluence 5.3-OD-15, create a child page of a space homepage that has an extended ASCII character in the title (ø, å, ü, etc.):
!childpage.png!
# Using IE8, mouse-over the link of the parent page in the sidebar that's under the "Child Pages" heading in the sidebar.

The URL that the parent page is linked to is https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?src=contextnavchildmode. Note the total lack of any actual page ID.

This also affects almost any generated link on the page. The problem seems to be coming from the {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-space-ia:soy-resources.js}}  script.
fields.summary: Extended ASCII characters in page titles break link rendering under IE8

fields.description: Using the latest Confluence in OnDemand, show the keyboards shortcuts screen and see the attached screenshot for the details.
fields.summary: String not externalised in the keyboard shortcuts page

fields.description:
h3. ***Current Behavior***
JIRA would not detect Confluence if the  *Site Title* in Confluence is left empty.

h3. ***Expected Behavior***
Confluence should throw an error when Site Title is left empty.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Go to General Configuration > Edit
# Remove the *Site Title* and leave it empty
# Refresh Application Navigator in Confluence 
# Go to JIRA 
# Refresh Application Navigator in JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA does not Detect Confluence if the "Site Title" in Confluence is Left Empty

fields.description:
I work for a company where we pull users via LDAP based on their email addresses. So, I do not have the option to follow Atlassian recommendation of not using email addresses as ids. In fact, I have been asked by management to change the value of the Username label to say "Email Address" in both, web and mobile apps.

If this was JIRA, it would be very simple:
Web: 
/data/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties
Mobile:
mobile-1.7.jar/jira/i18n.properties

But Confluence has a different setup. Tracing the class properties I saw they are packed in the following lib jar file:

/data/confluence/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-5.6.4.jar

If unpacking that jar, we see this file:
com/atlassian/confluence/core/ConfluenceActionSupport.properties

The lines are:
183 username.name=Username
4726 username.accesskey=Username

HERE IS THE BUG:

1) - If we change 4726 username.accesskey=Username to 4726 username.accesskey=Email Address then the web app and mobile app in landscape style reflect the change. But the mobile app in portrait style does not.
2) - If we also change line 183, then both, web app and mobile app will reflect the change. However, if we go to browse the User section in the dashboard as administrators we will see that the label for "Username" in the All Users table has been affected too, which makes no sense.

QUESTION:

1) - Can you separate the attributes of mobile labels from web labels just as you did in JIRA?

2) - If I want to fix the mobile app in portrait style (without spending another day unpacking jars) where exactly can I go an switch username.name to username.accesskey ? I need this only for the login page. I haven't tried yet but it would be nice if Atlassian can provide an accurate answer and I don't have to shoot darts and break the app.
fields.summary: Admin dashboard username label and portrait style mobile app login page seem to be both using the username.name attribute
